alert.note: Alert for Howell; Shannon; Texas (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 04 at 6:02PM CDT until July 05 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 815 PM CDT THIS EVENING... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of south central Missouri, including the following counties, Howell, Shannon and Texas. * WHEN...Until 815 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 600 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated that between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen over the advisory area. Runoff from this amount of rainfall has likely led to flooding of small creeks, streams and low water crossings. - This includes the following low water crossings... North Prong Jacks Fork at Arroll Road, Rocky Creek at Highway H, Little Rocky Creek at Highway H, Mahans Creek at County Road 501, Thomas Hollow at Highway H, Pine Hollow at Highway E and Rocky Creek at Highway NN. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Eminence, Summersville, Alley Spring, West Eminence, Round Spring, Pine Crest, Midridge, Arroll, Ozark National Scenic Riverways, Echo Bluff State Park and Current River State Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles.
